intro: ^Sorry, I’m a bit shocked! We, uh… don’t get a whole lot of visitors.

g-0: ^I see your boat over there has taken some damage. I’d offer to help fix it up, but…
^From the looks of it, I don’t think it can be salvaged.
^Could I ask what happened to it?
g-1: ^I was on my way here when a TENTACLE suddenly popped out of the water and hit my hull!
^You’ve heard of the Kraken, right? Well, uh, surprise! That’s what attacked you.

c-2: ^Oh, shoot! I don’t mean to scare you or anything.
^We have our ways of avoiding that menace, but… for an outsider, that must be quite a shock.
^When you’ve lived here as long as me, you just sorta get used to it!
^But, hey! You’re in one piece, at least! No need to look so glum!
c-3: ^... Y'know what? I'm not even going to question it.

g-3: ^I was sent this letter by someone who claims to live around here.
^It says my parents' boat was found here and, well, I'm looking to find out what happened to them.
^We did find an abandoned boat, but that was a whole decade ago.
^Sorry, letters are… not very easy to send out from here.
^Whoever wrote this might’ve been trying to reach you for a very long time by now.

c-5: ^Surely they can't be so hard to send out that they take a whole decade to arrive?
^We don't have a proper delivery system around here.
^Least of all one that goes beyond the archipelago.
^The sender most likely sent out that letter in a bottle, to start.
^And then someone else from the outside must've stumbled upon it and forwarded it to you.
^All things considered, you're lucky it wound up in the hands of someone willing to help out!
c-6: ^I see. That makes things harder for me...

g-4: ^That boat belonged to your parents, then?
^I owe it to you to give it back, but it’s not very... well-suited for a journey outta here right now.

c-7: ^It works! But I don’t recommend taking it outside the archipelago.
^The Kraken has a mean habit of preventing anyone from leaving.
^You'll want to make sure your boat can withstand some pushback before you try to leave.

g-5: ^You mentioned you’re a mechanic. Could you improve the boat for me?
^Some work for these idle hands? Why, I’d be happy to help you!
^In fact, there's one upgrade I can work in for you right now.
g-6: ^I'll go ahead and add that on now, then.
^Give me a moment! I'll be right back.
^[You hear a collection of bangs and clanks until he pops back out, wiping sweat off his brow.]
^But there are several more fixes you'll need, and I won't be able to help you with all of them.

c-10: ^I doubt you'd notice any difference, as long as you're just going around the archipelago...
^But when it's time to head outta here, those tiny details can really make or break your journey.

g-7: ^Alright, how do I go about getting more upgrades?
^You'll have to seek out my friends for those. There are four others...
^And Vera, the head of the fishing union!
^Talk to all of them and they'll hook you up with those handy upgrades.

c-12: ^That's all I have to do? What about payment?
^Thing is, we operate by trading favors around here. They might ask you to help them out in return.
^Oh, but don't worry! Mine's on the house. See it as a welcome present.

g-8: ^Good luck out there! And come see me if you have any questions or if you feel like chatting.
